definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.chinese: 它的相當緊絀回到那裏。

sentences.english: The University should not lay off its employees on the ground of financial stringency .
sentences.chinese: 校方不應以財政緊絀爲理由，解僱員工。

sentences.english: These items will be in a tight liquidity environment to compete.
sentences.chinese: 這些項目將在流動資金緊絀的環境的競爭力。

sentences.english: And maybe that's all you're looking for if you're on a tight budget.
sentences.chinese: 也許這就是所有您正在尋找如果您使用的是財政緊絀。

sentences.english: This was mainly due to some small and medium-sized banks have been tight liquidity situation.
sentences.chinese: 這主要是由於一些小型和中型銀行一直緊絀。
